abstract.p: McKesson Corp chairman-chief executive John H Hammergren, who after six years as chief executive is only 48, could quit and immediately collect full pension benefits as if he had worked until retirement; Hammergren would collect lump sum of almost $76 million (S)

block.p: John H. Hammergren has plenty of incentives to stay on as chairman and chief executive of the McKesson Corporation, the health care services giant based in San Francisco. But to pad his pension is not one of them.

Mr. Hammergren, who after six years as the chief executive is only 48, could quit tomorrow and immediately collect full pension benefits as if he had worked until retirement. How large would that lump sum be? Almost $76 million. McKesson disclosed that obligation in its latest proxy statement, though it said it had accounted for only about $35 million of it.
